reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-5142 - Bug fix

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: Please keep indentation in this comment. It's intented to facilitate a new developer to understand what information is on the table. With no indentation it becomes very hard to read.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: Keep the spacing on the comment.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
This should not be added here. Its a specific behaviour of the Manual Determination Rule and so its should be defined in the rule itself.
ManualDeterminationRule was changed some time ago to show in the rule definition column the added comment FAB-4789.
Now it was decided that a string should be shown, so this should be changed in the rule and not in the engine.
Replace this line in ManualDeterminationRule:
``` return createRuleAssessmentResult(null, determinationDataValue.getStringValue(), ValueMatch.UNDETERMINED, AbsenceDataType.STRING);
```
with
``` return createRuleAssessmentResult(null, APPLICABLE_TYPE_NAME, ValueMatch.UNDETERMINED, AbsenceDataType.STRING);
```
and remove the current comment in the rule.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: Keep previous indentation.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
This is a really messy method that is doing way too much. It is doing
1. Getting process by name 2. Creating transactions 3. Creating processes 4. Handling creating of page parameters 5. Handling creating of action redirect
Split this up into a couple of package access methods with sensible names and test each step.

comments.author: Gil Matias
comments.comment:
Is this a ABSENCE_PERIOD_DECISION DECISION_Reason
Or a ABSENCE_PERIOD_DECISION REASON?

comments.author: Gil Matias
comments.comment: the return javadoc text is a bit incomplete IMO

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Junits for these?

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: We normally dont have JUnits for these. This is merelly a list with all the validators to be executed. JUnits are added to the factory and to each validator itself.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Can we add _NoMessagesReturned_ to the test name

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Same comment as above

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Can we add _MessageReturned_ to the test name

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: What about when these return false?

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Can we add _MessageReturned_ to the test name

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Test for when this returns no message?

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
This test is just checking if the returned message list is the expected one. The actual test for the validator is made under AbsencePeriodDecisionReasonNotEmptyWhenDeniedValidatorTest.
A no message test would still return the same message list. The test for an empty list and no empty list is already done in validator test. Do you thing we need to add another one here?

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: I've changed the test and removed the message that was being added to the message list. We are not just testing if the returned message list is the expected one and we leave the actual validation testing for the validator test.

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-6223: Changed column size from 2000 char to 250 char
FAB-6066 - EnumMatrix remove getColumnTitles() method duplication
FAB-3872 - \'Leave Plan\' column tidy up
